reviewText: Saw the actual production and was impressed.  Serious issues treated seriously, but not without humor.  Some excellent acting.  Haven't seen the video - and know it's hard to film stage productions effectively - but thought these reactions might be of interest.

I've read Lessing's original NATHAN THE WISE (writtenn in the 18th century).

D'Andrea's adaptation takes the spirit of the original... and improves on it! (I feel like it's blasphemous to say that about a classic, but it's true).

Watching the news these days, you'd think the three big monotheisms (Judaism, Christianity, Islam) could never get along.

NATHAN THE WISE says otherwise.  Really opened my eyes about the deep commonalities among them.
